entry.name: notDeepEqual
entry.title: notDeepEqual()

argument.name: message
argument.desc: A short description of the assertion

entry.desc: An inverted deep recursive comparison assertion, working on primitive types, arrays, objects, regular expressions, dates and functions.

longdesc.p: The notDeepEqual() assertion can be used just like equal() when comparing the value of objects, such that { key: value } is equal to { key: value }. For non-scalar values, identity will be disregarded by notDeepEqual.
deepEqual() can be used to explicitly test deep, strict equality.

example.desc: Compare the value of two objects.
